tit.e: Toki no fuda (a board for time)
tit.cmt: カッコ部分を補いました。
tit.e: Toki no fuda (a board for time)

sen.j: 時の簡（ときのふだ）は、時刻を示すために清涼殿殿上の小庭に立てて置いた簡（ふだ）である。
sen.e: Toki no fuda is a card that was used to show time and placed in a small garden on the court of Seiryoden (Literally "Limpid Cool Hall").
The Toki no fuda was a board that was placed in a small garden in the Seiryoden (literally "Limpid Cool Hall") to show time.
sen.cmt: the を補いました。is→was,on the court of→in the,card→board,Literally→literally と修正しました。
sen.e: The Toki no fuda was a board that was placed in a small garden in the Seiryoden (literally "Limpid Cool Hall") to show time.

sen.j: 杙でささえて、時刻ごとにたてかえ、内豎がそのつとめにあたった。
sen.e: Toki no fuda was supported by a stake and replaced over time and naiju (government official especially one of low to medium rank as royal pages) took charge of the replacement.
The Toki no fuda was supported by a stake and replaced over time, and naiju (government official especially one of low to medium rank as royal pages) took charge of the replacement.
sen.cmt: the, カンマを補いました。
sen.e: The Toki no fuda was supported by a stake and replaced over time, and naiju (government official especially one of low to medium rank as royal pages) took charge of the replacement.

sen.j: 時の簡の位置については、『禁腋秘抄』に「下侍二間あり、東は妻戸なり、次一間蔀なり。
sen.e: "Kineki hisho (禁腋秘抄)" (a text describing rules and etiquette to be observed in the Seiryoden and Shishinden (The Throne Hall)) provided a location of Toki no fuda that "3.636 meter from a station that is staffed with retainers, and tsumado (a side entrance, hinged plank door that was placed at the four corners of the enclosure of a aristocrat's mansion) on the east side and next 1.818 meter is shitomi (a wooden lattice door which opens up vertically).
sen.cmt: 正しい読み方が不明です。
sen.e: "Kineki hisho" (禁腋秘抄) (a text describing rules and etiquette to be observed in the Seiryoden and Shishinden [The Throne Hall]) described the location of Toki no fuda, that 'c. 3.6 m from a station that is staffed with retainers, and tsumado (a side entrance, hinged plank door that was placed at the four corners of the enclosure of a aristocrat's mansion) on the east side and the next c. 1.818 m is shitomi (a wooden lattice door which opens up vertically).
sen.cmt: クォーツ部分を修正しました。カッコ内カッコを修正しました。カンマ、the を補いました。provided→described,a→the,それぞれ二間、一間は”約1.8ｍ”と修正しました。「禁腋秘抄」の読みは確認出来ておりません。
sen.e: "Kineki hisho" (禁腋秘抄) (a text describing rules and etiquette to be observed in the Seiryoden and Shishinden [The Throne Hall]) described the location of Toki no fuda, that 'c. 3.6 m from a station that is staffed with retainers, and tsumado (a side entrance, hinged plank door that was placed at the four corners of the enclosure of a aristocrat's mansion) on the east side and the next c. 1.818 m is shitomi (a wooden lattice door which opens up vertically).

sen.j: 二つにわりて、西は、おろして、御膳（もの）棚をその前に立て、そばに時の簡をたてたり」とある。
sen.e: Open shitone, put down the east side door and stand high quality shelf in front and put Toki no fuda on it.
Open shitone, put down the west side door and stand the pantry shelf in front and place Toki no fuda bear by.'
sen.cmt: east→west,「御膳（もの）棚＝配膳用の棚」として修正しました。put→place,on it→near by と修正しました。
sen.e: Open shitone, put down the west side door and stand the pantry shelf in front and place Toki no fuda bear by.'

sen.j: 一昼夜12時を各時4刻にわけ、第4刻のときのみ時の杙をさしたらしい。
sen.e: Divide 12 hours into daytime and 12hours into night time into 4, replace Toki no fuda at 4th time and stand it with a stake".
It supposed to be dividing the day and night of 12 hours into 4, then inserting the stake of time only on the 4th time.
sen.cmt: 文脈に応じて修正しました。
